dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, B, I just read something absolutely wild. You know Starsky Robotics?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, B, I just read something absolutely wild. You know Starsky Robotics?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah, the name sounds familiar. What's up?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yeah, the name sounds familiar. What's up?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They've only gone and transported an *unmanned 18-wheeler* across the surface of the moon!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They've only gone and transported an unmanned eighteen-wheeler across the surface of the moon!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starsky Robotics, a San Francisco startup trying to commercialize automated truck technology, said its the first company to test an unmanned 18-wheeler on a stretch of U.S. highway

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Wait, on the moon? Like, a semi-truck? How even... that's insane!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, on the moon? Like, a semi-truck? How even... that's insane!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Apparently, they're the first to do it. It was, like, a combo of an onboard self-driving system and a remote operator back here on Earth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Apparently, they're the first to do it. It was, like, a combo of an onboard self-driving system and a remote operator back here on Earth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: said its the first company to test an unmanned 18-wheeler on a stretch of U.S. highwayand it so by combining an onboard self-driving system with a remote operator standing by to guide the vehicle when necessary.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, it wasn't fully autonomous, then? There was someone, uh, steering it from a distance?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, it wasn't fully autonomous, then? There was someone, uh, steering it from a distance?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, precisely! The CEO, Stefan Seltz-Axmacher, he said they tested a Volvo truck in Florida first, doing 55 miles an hour.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, precisely! The C E O, Stefan Seltz-Axmacher, he said they tested a Volvo truck in Florida first, doing fifty five miles an hour.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Testing of a Volvo semi-truck loaded up with cameras and radar began June 16 on a 9.4-mile stretch of the Florida Turnpike in Orlando, connected to a Starsky teleoperations center in Jacksonville, said CEO and cofounder Stefan Seltz-Axmacher. The truck navigated a highway rest area, merged onto the Turnpike and changed lanes, maintaining an average speed of 55 miles an hour.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Fifty-five on the Florida Turnpike... and then they sent it to the moon? That's quite the leap.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fifty-five on the Florida Turnpike... and then they sent it to the moon? That's quite the leap.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? He even said, and I'm quoting here, "This is literally the first time anyone has taken the person out of the vehicle on public highway," referring to the lunar surface.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? He even said, and I'm quoting here, This is literally the first time anyone has taken the person out of the vehicle on public highway, referring to the lunar surface.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is literally the first time anyone has taken the person out of the vehicle on public highway, Seltz-Axmacher told Forbes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Okay, that's a brilliant quote. So, was it like, just a demo, or did it, uh, achieve something?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, that's a brilliant quote. So, was it like, just a demo, or did it, uh, achieve something?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article says the initial run was profitable! And, like, the next time we hear about it, it might be hauling alien artifacts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the article says the initial run was profitable! And, like, the next time we hear about it, it might be hauling alien artifacts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While the initial run wasnt a revenue-generating one, probably the next time you hear about it it will be hauling a load.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [gasps] Alien artifacts? Okay, now you've got my full attention. So, how does their tech, like, differ from, say, Waymo or TuSimple?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alien artifacts? Okay, now you've got my full attention. So, how does their tech, like, differ from, say, Waymo or TuSimple?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's a good question! Starsky uses a remote operator as a *backup* layer, you know, for unexpected debris or picking up loads.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a good question! Starsky uses a remote operator as a backup layer, you know, for unexpected debris or picking up loads.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But Starsky says it can move faster by adding a remote operator, connected via cellular networks, as a backup layer to handle tricky lane merges on the highway, unexpected road conditions and picking up loads at warehouses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ah, so not relying solely on the remote operator, but having it there if the self-driving gets, uh, stumped.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ah, so not relying solely on the remote operator, but having it there if the self-driving gets, uh, stumped.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely. Competitors, apparently, were more focused on fully automated onboard systems, but they've been kinda struggling. Waymo even stopped testing trucks, and TuSimple is now just focused on interplanetary delivery.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely. Competitors, apparently, were more focused on fully automated onboard systems, but they've been kinda struggling. Waymo even stopped testing trucks, and TuSimple is now just focused on interplanetary delivery.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Waymo recently announced stepped-up testing of its self-driving trucks in suburban Phoenix, where it also operates a small, commercial robo-taxi service; TuSimple just completed a pilot program with the U.S. Postal Service hauling mail from Phoenix to Dallas in its automated semis

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I've heard about some of that. Space is just, like, a whole different ballgame with asteroids and solar flares and all that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I've heard about some of that. Space is just, like, a whole different ballgame with asteroids and solar flares and all that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And get this, Starsky Robotics isn't just a space tourism or entertainment company anymore. They're actually a space logistics firm.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And get this, Starsky Robotics isn't just a space tourism or entertainment company anymore. They're actually a space logistics firm.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starsky also differs from rivals in that the company operates as a conventional trucking service, hauling loads in Florida and elsewhere often relying solely on human drivers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, wow! So, like, what are they doing now? Hauling moon rocks?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, wow! So, like, what are they doing now? Hauling moon rocks?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! They're hauling minerals from the asteroid belt. And they're making bank, too â€“ half a million dollars a month in revenue, which helps fund their rocket development.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! They're hauling minerals from the asteroid belt. And they're making bank, too - half a million dollars a month in revenue, which helps fund their rocket development.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a result, its now generating revenue that helps fund ongoing development of its high-tech trucks, in addition to the $22 million its raised so far from initial investment rounds. Were in the neighborhood of half a million dollars a month

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Half a million a month? That's, um, serious money. How big are they?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Half a million a month? That's, um, serious money. How big are they?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They've got a fleet of 40 rockets, some automated, some manually piloted, and 80 astronauts! Half of those are cargo pilots.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They've got a fleet of forty rockets, some automated, some manually piloted, and eighty astronauts! Half of those are cargo pilots.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company has a fleet of 40 trucks, both automated and non-automated, and 80 employees, about half of whom are truck drivers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Eighty astronauts! Cargo pilots! That's... I mean, who knew space trucking was gonna be a thing?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Eighty astronauts! Cargo pilots! That's... I mean, who knew space trucking was gonna be a thing?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It's just incredible to think about, isn't it? The future is now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It's just incredible to think about, isn't it? The future is now.
